verbs.description: sjc [V: ruling] favors baker effort to end taxpayer - funded motels for homeless the supreme judicial court ruled thursday that the state can continue to use taxpayer - funded motel rooms solely as housing of last resort for homeless families reversing a lower court mandate that expanded the set of circumstances when motel rooms had to be used the 5 - 2 high court decision vacated a preliminary injunction that required the state place homeless families with recognized disabilities in a motel if available shelters could n’t suffolk superior court boston american civil liberties union justice barbara a lenk massachusetts jessica rinaldiglobe ruth bourquin charlie baker baseball department of housing and community development baker boston children hospital garcia boston childrens hospital barbara lenk jessica rinaldi globe charlie baker sjc supreme judicial court
